title: Billy Idol - 11 of the Best [24 bit FLAC] vinyl
description:
Billy Idol - 11 of the Best [24 bit FLAC] vinyl

  Genre: Pop/Rock
  Style: New Wave
  Source: vinyl
  Codec: FLAC
  Bit Rate: ~ 2,900 kbps
  Bit Depth: 24
  Sampling Rate: 96,000 Hz

  01 Rebel Yell
  02 Hot In The City
  03 White Wedding 
  04 Eyes Without A Face
  05 Catch My Fall
  06 Mony Mony
  07 To Be A Lover
  08 Sweet Sixteen
  09 Flesh For Fantasy
  10 Don't Need A Gun
  11 Dancing With Myself

  Along with Duran Duran, Billy Idol was one the first pop/rock artists to achieve massive success in the early '80s due to a then brand-new U.S. television network, MTV. Mixing his bad-boy good looks with an appealing blend of pop hooks, punk attitude, and a dance beats, Idol quickly rocketed to stardom, before hard living derailed his career and almost proved fatal. Born William Michael Albert Broad on November 30, 1955, in Middlesex, England, the youngster relocated with his family for a brief spell to New York, before returning back to England. After a stint at Sussex University only last a year, Broad found himself as part of a group of teen punk rockers who befriended and followed the Sex Pistols, known as "the Bromley Contingent"
